titles.title: Economic Stimulus Package
Emergency Supplemental Appropriations Act of 1993
Emergency Supplemental Appropriations Act of 1993
Emergency Supplemental Appropriations Act of 1993
Emergency Supplemental Appropriations Act of 1993
Making emergency supplemental appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1993, and for other purposes.

action.text: Committee on Appropriations; Senate Subcommittee on Transportation. Hearings held prior to introduction and/or referral. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 103-34.
The House Committee on Appropriations reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-30, by Mr. Natcher.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 14.

action.text: Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 130 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1335 with 1 hour of general debate. The first reading of the bill will be dispensed with. Points of order against consideration of the bill for failure to comply with clause 2(l)(6) of rule XI or clause 7 of rule XXI are waived. Following general debate, the Committee of the Whole shall rise without motion and no further consideration of the bill shall be in order except pursuant to a subsequent order of the House.
Rule H. Res. 130 passed House.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 130.
House resolved itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H. Res. 130 and Rule XXIII.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Larry LaRocco to act as Chairman of the Committee.
GENERAL DEBATE - The Committee of the Whole proceeded with one hour of general debate.
Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union rises leaving H.R. 1335 as unfinished business.

Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 132 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1335. Previous question shall be considered as ordered except motion to recommit. Upon adoption of this resolution, it shall be in order to further consider the bill in the House and all points of order against the bill shall be waived. A specified amendment is in order. It shall be in order to consider an amendment offered by the chairman of the Committee on Appropriations. The amendment shall be considered as read, shall be debatable for 10 minutes, shall not be subject to amendment, and shall not be subject to a demand for a division of the question. All points of order against the amendment shall be waived.
Rule H. Res. 132 passed House.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 132.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1335. Previous question shall be considered as ordered except motion to recommit. Upon adoption of this resolution, it shall be in order to further consider the bill in the House and all points of order against the bill shall be waived. A specified amendment is in order. It shall be in order to consider an amendment offered by the chairman of the Committee on Appropriations. The amendment shall be considered as read, shall be debatable for 10 minutes, shall not be subject to amendment, and shall not be subject to a demand for a division of the question. All points of order against the amendment shall be waived.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
Mr. McDade moved to recommit with instructions to Appropriations.

Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 132, the House proceeded with one hour of debate on the McDade motion to recommit with instructions. The instructions require the bill to be reported back to the House with an amendment which would strike everything under Title 1 with the exception of the text dealing with Advances to the Unemployment Trust Fund and other Funds; and further, to produce a separate bill containing the funding stricken from Title 1 of H.R. 1335 but with text bringing such a bill into compliance with the discretionary spending ceilings established by the Budget Enforcement Act of 1990 so as not to increase the deficit further than the estimated deficit of $319 billion that is already forecast for this fiscal year.
On motion to recommit with instructions Failed by recorded vote: 181 - 244 (Roll no. 87).

vote.text: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 235 - 190 (Roll No. 88).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Appropriations.

calendar.text: Committee on Appropriations. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

action.text: Committee on Appropriations. Reported to Senate by Senator Byrd with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 44.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

Amendment SP 270 proposed by Senator Byrd to Amendment SP 269.

Amendment SP 269 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

Considered by Senate.

Motion to reconsider the vote on SP 279 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52-48. Record Vote No: 85.
Motion to table SP 279 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52-48. Record Vote No: 86.

Recommitted to Senate Committee on Appropriations with instructions to report back forthwith with an amendment (sp283) in the nature of a substitute by Voice Vote.
SP 271, SP 272, SP 281, SP 282 fell when the motion to recommit was agreed to.

Committee on Appropriations reported the bill, pursuant to the instructions of the motion to recommit.

SP 287 ruled out of order by the chair.

Motion to table SP 301 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53-45. Record Vote No: 103.
Amendment SP 300 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52-46. Record Vote No: 104.
Considered by Senate.

Amendment SP 283 as modified agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.
The committee substitute as modified as amended agreed to by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Mr. Natcher asked unanimous consent that it be in order today to consider in the House, any rule of the House to the contrary notwithstanding, a motion to take from the Speaker's table the bill H.R. 1335, with a Senate amendment thereto, and to concur in the Senate amendment; that the Senate amendment be considered as read; that the motion be debatable for one hour, equally divided and controlled by the chairman and ranking minority member of the Committee on Appropriations or their designees; and that the previous question be considered as ordered on the motion to final adoption without intervening motion. Agreed to without objection.
Pursuant to a previous special order the House moved to agree to the Senate amendment.
DEBATE - Pursuant to a previous order of the House, the House proceeded with one hour of debate on the motion to agree to the Senate amendment.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
The previous question was ordered by the unanimous consent request previously agreed to.

vote.text: On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 301 - 114 (Roll no. 142).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

term.name: Department of Health and Human Services
Department of Housing and Urban Development
Federal aid to minority business enterprises
Federal aid to water pollution control
Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary: 4/21/1993--Passed Senate amended. Emergency Supplemental Appropriations Act of 1993 - Makes emergency supplemental appropriations to the Department of Labor for advances to the Unemployment Trust Fund and other funds to remain available until September 30, 1994.
